intro: Seseli proliferum, commonly known as the clustered seseli, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as cliffs and slopes. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to rock gardens and native plant collections.
